intro: Psychotria nacdado, commonly known as the Red-veined Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on its dark green leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Psychotria nacdado is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
